level.text: Violation of the following provision shall be a Class 1 infraction: 22 DCMR § 301.1 (operating a tissue bank without a license).
Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 2 infraction:
22 DCMR § 300.3 (failure to manage and operate a tissue bank in accordance with good medical and public health practice);
22 DCMR § 302.1 (failure to have a physician as director and operator of the bank);
22 DCMR § 302.2 (failure to maintain a roster of authorized persons and to establish policies and procedures for operation of the bank);
22 DCMR § 302.4 (failure of a hospital licensee to designate a physician as director and operator of the bank);
22 DCMR § 303 (failure to comply with requirements concerning tissue acquisition, tissue withdrawal, and recordkeeping);
22 DCMR § 304 (failure to comply with physical and sanitary requirements);
22 DCMR § 305.2 (failure to cooperate in an inspection); or
22 DCMR § 306.1 (transporting tissue without the required record).
Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 3 infraction:
22 DCMR § 301.4 (failure to sign and certify application for license);
22 DCMR §302.3 (failure to provide policies and procedures for inspection upon request); or
22 DCMR § 302.6 (failure to notify of change in operator).
Violation of the following provision shall be a Class 4 infraction:22 DCMR § 301.10 (failure to frame and post license).
